content: 6 When the disciples heard this, they fell facedown in terror.

title: Matthew 17:7
content: 7 Then Jesus came over and touched them. “Get up,” He said. “Do not be afraid.”

title: Matthew 17:8
content: 8 And when they looked up, they saw no one except Jesus.

title: Matthew 17:9
content: 9 As they were coming down the mountain, Jesus commanded them, “Do not tell anyone about this vision until the Son of Man has been raised from the dead.”

title: Matthew 17:10
content: 10 The disciples asked Him, “Why then do the scribes say that Elijah must come first?”

title: Matthew 17:11
content: 11 Jesus replied, “Elijah does indeed come, and he will restore all things.

title: Matthew 17:12
content: 12 But I tell you that Elijah has already come, and they did not recognize him, but have done to him whatever they wished. In the same way, the Son of Man will suffer at their hands.”

title: Matthew 17:13
content: 13 Then the disciples understood that He was speaking to them about John the Baptist.

title: Matthew 17:14
content: 14 When they came to the crowd, a man came up to Jesus and knelt before Him.

title: Matthew 17:15
content: 15 “Lord, have mercy on my son,” he said. “He has seizures and is suffering terribly. He often falls into the fire or into the water.

title: Matthew 17:16
content: 16 I brought him to Your disciples, but they could not heal him.”

title: Matthew 17:17
content: 17 “O unbelieving and perverse generation!” Jesus replied. “How long must I remain with you? How long must I put up with you? Bring the boy here to Me.”

title: Matthew 17:18
content: 18 Then Jesus rebuked the demon, and it came out of the boy, and he was healed from that moment.

title: Matthew 17:19
content: 19 Afterward the disciples came to Jesus privately and asked, “Why couldn’t we drive it out?”

title: Matthew 17:20
content: 20 “Because you have so little faith,” He answered. “For truly I tell you, if you have faith the size of a mustard seed, you can say to this mountain, ‘Move from here to there,’ and it will move. Nothing will be impossible for you.”

title: Matthew 17:22
content: 22 When they gathered together in Galilee, Jesus told them, “The Son of Man is about to be delivered into the hands of men.

title: Matthew 17:23
content: 23 They will kill Him, and on the third day He will be raised to life.” And the disciples were deeply grieved.

title: Matthew 17:24
content: 24 After they had arrived in Capernaum, the collectors of the two-drachma tax came to Peter and asked, “Does your Teacher pay the two drachmas?”

title: Matthew 17:25
content: 25 “Yes,” he answered. When Peter entered the house, Jesus preempted him. “What do you think, Simon?” He asked. “From whom do the kings of the earth collect customs and taxes: from their own sons, or from others?”

title: Matthew 17:26
content: 26 “From others,” Peter answered. “Then the sons are exempt,” Jesus said to him.

title: Matthew 17:27
content: 27 “But so that we may not offend them, go to the sea, cast a hook, and take the first fish you catch. When you open its mouth, you will find a four-drachma coin. Take it and give it to them for My tax and yours.”

title: Matthew 18:1
content: 1 At that time the disciples came to Jesus and asked, “Who then is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven?”

title: Matthew 18:2
content: 2 Jesus invited a little child to stand among them.

title: Matthew 18:3
content: 3 “Truly I tell you,” He said, “unless you change and become like little children, you will never enter the kingdom of heaven.

title: Matthew 18:4
content: 4 Therefore, whoever humbles himself like this little child is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven.

title: Matthew 18:5
content: 5 And whoever welcomes a little child like this in My name welcomes Me.

title: Matthew 18:6
content: 6 But if anyone causes one of these little ones who believe in Me to stumble, it would be better for him to have a large millstone hung around his neck and to be drowned in the depths of the sea.

title: Matthew 18:7
content: 7 Woe to the world for the causes of sin. These stumbling blocks must come, but woe to the man through whom they come!

title: Matthew 18:8
content: 8 If your hand or your foot causes you to sin, cut it off and throw it away. It is better for you to enter life crippled or lame than to have two hands and two feet and be thrown into the eternal fire.

title: Matthew 18:9
content: 9 And if your eye causes you to sin, gouge it out and throw it away. It is better for you to enter life with one eye than to have two eyes and be thrown into the fire of hell.

title: Matthew 18:10
content: 10 See that you do not look down on any of these little ones. For I tell you that their angels in heaven always see the face of My Father in heaven.

title: Matthew 18:12
content: 12 What do you think? If a man has a hundred sheep and one of them goes astray, will he not leave the ninety-nine on the hills and go out to search for the one that is lost?

title: Matthew 18:13
content: 13 And if he finds it, truly I tell you, he rejoices more over that one sheep than over the ninety-nine that did not go astray.

title: Matthew 18:14
content: 14 In the same way, your Father in heaven is not willing that any of these little ones should perish.

title: Matthew 18:15
content: 15 If your brother sins against you, go and confront him privately. If he listens to you, you have won your brother over.

title: Matthew 18:16
content: 16 But if he will not listen, take one or two others along, so that ‘every matter may be established by the testimony of two or three witnesses.’

title: Matthew 18:17
content: 17 If he refuses to listen to them, tell it to the church. And if he refuses to listen even to the church, regard him as you would a pagan or a tax collector.

title: Matthew 18:18
content: 18 Truly I tell you, whatever you bind on earth will be bound in heaven, and whatever you loose on earth will be loosed in heaven.

title: Matthew 18:19
content: 19 Again, I tell you truly that if two of you on the earth agree about anything you ask for, it will be done for you by My Father in heaven.

title: Matthew 18:20
content: 20 For where two or three gather together in My name, there am I with them.”

title: Matthew 18:21
content: 21 Then Peter came to Jesus and asked, “Lord, how many times shall I forgive my brother who sins against me? Up to seven times?”

title: Matthew 18:22
content: 22 Jesus answered, “I tell you, not just seven times, but seventy-seven times!

title: Matthew 18:23
content: 23 Because of this, the kingdom of heaven is like a king who wanted to settle accounts with his servants.

title: Matthew 18:24
content: 24 As he began the settlements, a debtor owing ten thousand talents was brought to him.

title: Matthew 18:25
content: 25 Since the man was unable to pay, the master ordered that he be sold to pay his debt, along with his wife and children and everything he owned.

title: Matthew 18:26
content: 26 Then the servant fell on his knees before him. ‘Have patience with me,’ he begged, ‘and I will pay back everything.’

title: Matthew 18:27
content: 27 His master had compassion on him, forgave his debt, and released him.

title: Matthew 18:28
content: 28 But when that servant went out, he found one of his fellow servants who owed him a hundred denarii. He grabbed him and began to choke him, saying, ‘Pay back what you owe me!’

title: Matthew 18:29
content: 29 So his fellow servant fell down and begged him, ‘Have patience with me, and I will pay you back.’

title: Matthew 18:30
content: 30 But he refused. Instead, he went and had the man thrown into prison until he could pay his debt.

title: Matthew 18:31
content: 31 When his fellow servants saw what had happened, they were greatly distressed, and they went and recounted all of this to their master.

title: Matthew 18:32
content: 32 Then the master summoned him and said, ‘You wicked servant! I forgave all your debt because you begged me.

title: Matthew 18:33
content: 33 Shouldn’t you have had mercy on your fellow servant, just as I had on you?’

title: Matthew 18:34
content: 34 In anger his master turned him over to the jailers to be tortured, until he should repay all that he owed.

title: Matthew 18:35
content: 35 That is how My heavenly Father will treat each of you unless you forgive your brother from your heart.”

title: Matthew 19:1
content: 1 When Jesus had finished saying these things, He left Galilee and went into the region of Judea beyond the Jordan.

title: Matthew 19:2
content: 2 Large crowds followed Him, and He healed them there.

title: Matthew 19:3
content: 3 Then some Pharisees came and tested Him by asking, “Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife for any reason?”

title: Matthew 19:4
content: 4 Jesus answered, “Have you not read that from the beginning the Creator ‘made them male and female,’

title: Matthew 19:5
content: 5 and said, ‘For this reason a man will leave his father and mother and be united to his wife, and the two will become one flesh’?

title: Matthew 19:6
content: 6 So they are no longer two, but one flesh. Therefore what God has joined together, let man not separate.”

title: Matthew 19:7
content: 7 “Why then,” they asked, “did Moses order a man to give his wife a certificate of divorce and send her away?”

title: Matthew 19:8
content: 8 Jesus replied, “Moses permitted you to divorce your wives because of your hardness of heart. But it was not this way from the beginning.

title: Matthew 19:9
content: 9 Now I tell you that whoever divorces his wife, except for sexual immorality, and marries another woman commits adultery.”

title: Matthew 19:10
content: 10 His disciples said to Him, “If this is the case between a man and his wife, it is better not to marry.”

title: Matthew 19:11
content: 11 “Not everyone can accept this word,” He replied, “but only those to whom it has been given.

title: Matthew 19:12
content: 12 For there are eunuchs who were born that way; others were made that way by men; and still others live like eunuchs for the sake of the kingdom of heaven. The one who can accept this should accept it.”

title: Matthew 19:13
content: 13 Then little children were brought to Jesus for Him to place His hands on them and pray for them. And the disciples rebuked those who brought them.

title: Matthew 19:14
content: 14 But Jesus said, “Let the little children come to Me, and do not hinder them! For the kingdom of heaven belongs to such as these.”

title: Matthew 19:15
content: 15 And after He had placed His hands on them, He went on from there.

title: Matthew 19:16
content: 16 Just then a man came up to Jesus and inquired, “Teacher, what good thing must I do to obtain eternal life?”

title: Matthew 19:17
content: 17 “Why do you ask Me about what is good?” Jesus replied. “There is only One who is good. If you want to enter life, keep the commandments.”

title: Matthew 19:18
content: 18 “Which ones?” the man asked. Jesus answered, “‘Do not murder, do not commit adultery, do not steal, do not bear false witness,

title: Matthew 19:19
content: 19 honor your father and mother, and love your neighbor as yourself.’”

title: Matthew 19:20
content: 20 “All these I have kept,” said the young man. “What do I still lack?”

title: Matthew 19:21
content: 21 Jesus told him, “If you want to be perfect, go, sell your possessions and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come, follow Me.”

title: Matthew 19:22
content: 22 When the young man heard this, he went away in sorrow, because he had great wealth.

title: Matthew 19:23
content: 23 Then Jesus said to His disciples, “Truly I tell you, it is hard for a rich man to enter the kingdom of heaven.

title: Matthew 19:24
content: 24 Again I tell you, it is easier for a camel to pass through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of God.”

title: Matthew 19:25
content: 25 When the disciples heard this, they were greatly astonished and asked, “Who then can be saved?”

title: Matthew 19:26
content: 26 Jesus looked at them and said, “With man this is impossible, but with God all things are possible.”

title: Matthew 19:27
content: 27 “Look,” Peter replied, “we have left everything to follow You. What then will there be for us?”

title: Matthew 19:28
content: 28 Jesus said to them, “Truly I tell you, in the renewal of all things, when the Son of Man sits on His glorious throne, you who have followed Me will also sit on twelve thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.

title: Matthew 19:29
content: 29 And everyone who has left houses or brothers or sisters or father or mother or wife or children or fields for the sake of My name will receive a hundredfold and will inherit eternal life.

title: Matthew 19:30
content: 30 But many who are first will be last, and the last will be first.

title: Matthew 20:1
content: 1 “For the kingdom of heaven is like a landowner who went out early in the morning to hire workers for his vineyard.

title: Matthew 20:2
content: 2 He agreed to pay them a denarius for the day and sent them into his vineyard.

title: Matthew 20:3
content: 3 About the third hour he went out and saw others standing in the marketplace doing nothing.

title: Matthew 20:4
content: 4 ‘You also go into my vineyard,’ he said, ‘and I will pay you whatever is right.’

title: Matthew 20:5
content: 5 So they went. He went out again about the sixth hour and the ninth hour and did the same thing.

title: Matthew 20:6
content: 6 About the eleventh hour he went out and found still others standing around. ‘Why have you been standing here all day long doing nothing?’ he asked.

title: Matthew 20:7
content: 7 ‘Because no one has hired us,’ they answered. So he told them, ‘You also go into my vineyard.’

title: Matthew 20:8
content: 8 When evening came, the owner of the vineyard said to his foreman, ‘Call the workers and pay them their wages, starting with the last ones hired and moving on to the first.’

title: Matthew 20:9
content: 9 The workers who were hired about the eleventh hour came and each received a denarius.

title: Matthew 20:10
content: 10 So when the original workers came, they assumed they would receive more. But each of them also received a denarius.

title: Matthew 20:11
content: 11 On receiving their pay, they began to grumble against the landowner.

title: Matthew 20:12
content: 12 ‘These men who were hired last worked only one hour,’ they said, ‘and you have made them equal to us who have borne the burden and the scorching heat of the day.’

title: Matthew 20:13
content: 13 But he answered one of them, ‘Friend, I am not being unfair to you. Did you not agree with me on one denarius?

title: Matthew 20:14
content: 14 Take your pay and go. I want to give this last man the same as I gave you.

title: Matthew 20:15
content: 15 Do I not have the right to do as I please with what is mine? Or are you envious because I am generous?’

title: Matthew 20:16
content: 16 So the last will be first, and the first will be last.”

title: Matthew 20:17
content: 17 As Jesus was going up to Jerusalem, He took the twelve disciples aside and said,

title: Matthew 20:18
content: 18 “Look, we are going up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be delivered over to the chief priests and scribes. They will condemn Him to death

title: Matthew 20:19
content: 19 and will deliver Him over to the Gentiles to be mocked and flogged and crucified. And on the third day He will be raised to life.”

title: Matthew 20:20
content: 20 Then the mother of Zebedee’s sons came to Jesus with her sons and knelt down to make a request of Him.

title: Matthew 20:21
content: 21 “What do you want?” He inquired. She answered, “Declare that in Your kingdom one of these two sons of mine may sit at Your right hand, and the other at Your left.”

title: Matthew 20:22
content: 22 “You do not know what you are asking,” Jesus replied. “Can you drink the cup I am going to drink?” “We can,” the brothers answered.

title: Matthew 20:23
content: 23 “You will indeed drink My cup,” Jesus said. “But to sit at My right or left is not Mine to grant. These seats belong to those for whom My Father has prepared them.”

title: Matthew 20:24
content: 24 When the ten heard about this, they were indignant with the two brothers.

title: Matthew 20:25
content: 25 But Jesus called them aside and said, “You know that the rulers of the Gentiles lord it over them, and their superiors exercise authority over them.

title: Matthew 20:26
content: 26 It shall not be this way among you. Instead, whoever wants to become great among you must be your servant,

title: Matthew 20:27
content: 27 and whoever wants to be first among you must be your slave—

title: Matthew 20:28
content: 28 just as the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give His life as a ransom for many.”

title: Matthew 20:29
content: 29 As they were leaving Jericho, a large crowd followed Him.

title: Matthew 20:30
content: 30 And there were two blind men sitting beside the road. When they heard that Jesus was passing by, they cried out, “Lord, Son of David, have mercy on us!”

title: Matthew 20:31
content: 31 The crowd admonished them to be silent, but they cried out all the louder, “Lord, Son of David, have mercy on us!”

title: Matthew 20:32
content: 32 Jesus stopped and called them. “What do you want Me to do for you?” He asked.

title: Matthew 20:33
content: 33 “Lord,” they answered, “let our eyes be opened.”

title: Matthew 20:34
content: 34 Moved with compassion, Jesus touched their eyes, and at once they received their sight and followed Him.

title: Matthew 21:1
content: 1 As they approached Jerusalem and came to Bethphage on the Mount of Olives, Jesus sent out two disciples,

title: Matthew 21:2
content: 2 saying to them, “Go into the village ahead of you, and at once you will find a donkey tied there, with her colt beside her. Untie them and bring them to Me.

title: Matthew 21:3
content: 3 If anyone questions you, tell him that the Lord needs them, and he will send them right away.”

title: Matthew 21:4
content: 4 This took place to fulfill what was spoken through the prophet:

title: Matthew 21:5
content: 5 “Say to the Daughter of Zion, ‘See, your King comes to you, gentle and riding on a donkey, on a colt, the foal of a donkey.’”

title: Matthew 21:6
content: 6 So the disciples went and did as Jesus had directed them.

title: Matthew 21:7
content: 7 They brought the donkey and the colt and laid their cloaks on them, and Jesus sat on them.

title: Matthew 21:8
content: 8 A massive crowd spread their cloaks on the road, while others cut branches from the trees and spread them on the road.

title: Matthew 21:9
content: 9 The crowds that went ahead of Him and those that followed were shouting: “Hosanna to the Son of David!” “Blessed is He who comes in the name of the Lord!” “Hosanna in the highest!”

title: Matthew 21:10
content: 10 When Jesus had entered Jerusalem, the whole city was stirred and asked, “Who is this?”

title: Matthew 21:11
content: 11 The crowds replied, “This is Jesus, the prophet from Nazareth in Galilee.”

title: Matthew 21:12
content: 12 Then Jesus entered the temple courts and drove out all who were buying and selling there. He overturned the tables of the money changers and the seats of those selling doves.

title: Matthew 21:13
content: 13 And He declared to them, “It is written: ‘My house will be called a house of prayer.’ But you are making it ‘a den of robbers.’”

title: Matthew 21:14
content: 14 The blind and the lame came to Him at the temple, and He healed them.

title: Matthew 21:15
content: 15 But the chief priests and scribes were indignant when they saw the wonders He performed and the children shouting in the temple courts, “Hosanna to the Son of David!”

title: Matthew 21:16
content: 16 “Do You hear what these children are saying?” they asked. “Yes,” Jesus answered. “Have you never read: ‘From the mouths of children and infants You have ordained praise’?”

title: Matthew 21:17
content: 17 Then He left them and went out of the city to Bethany, where He spent the night.

title: Matthew 21:18
content: 18 In the morning, as Jesus was returning to the city, He was hungry.

title: Matthew 21:19
content: 19 Seeing a fig tree by the road, He went up to it but found nothing on it except leaves. “May you never bear fruit again!” He said. And immediately the tree withered.

title: Matthew 21:20
content: 20 When the disciples saw this, they marveled and asked, “How did the fig tree wither so quickly?”

title: Matthew 21:21
content: 21 “Truly I tell you,” Jesus replied, “if you have faith and do not doubt, not only will you do what was done to the fig tree, but even if you say to this mountain, ‘Be lifted up and thrown into the sea,’ it will happen.

title: Matthew 21:22
content: 22 If you believe, you will receive whatever you ask for in prayer.”

title: Matthew 21:23
content: 23 When Jesus returned to the temple courts and began to teach, the chief priests and elders of the people came up to Him. “By what authority are You doing these things?” they asked. “And who gave You this authority?”

title: Matthew 21:24
content: 24 “I will also ask you one question,” Jesus replied, “and if you answer Me, I will tell you by what authority I am doing these things.

title: Matthew 21:25
content: 25 What was the source of John’s baptism? Was it from heaven or from men?” They deliberated among themselves and said, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ He will ask, ‘Why then did you not believe him?’

title: Matthew 21:26
content: 26 But if we say, ‘From men,’ we are afraid of the people, for they all regard John as a prophet.”

title: Matthew 21:27
content: 27 So they answered, “We do not know.” And Jesus replied, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I am doing these things.

title: Matthew 21:28
content: 28 But what do you think? There was a man who had two sons. He went to the first one and said, ‘Son, go and work today in the vineyard.’

title: Matthew 21:29
content: 29 ‘I will not,’ he replied. But later he changed his mind and went.

title: Matthew 21:30
content: 30 Then the man went to the second son and told him the same thing. ‘I will, sir,’ he said. But he did not go.

title: Matthew 21:31
content: 31 Which of the two did the will of his father?” “The first,” they answered. Jesus said to them, “Truly I tell you, the tax collectors and prostitutes are entering the kingdom of God before you.

title: Matthew 21:32
content: 32 For John came to you in the way of righteousness, and you did not believe him, but the tax collectors and prostitutes did. And even after you saw this, you did not repent and believe him.

title: Matthew 21:33
content: 33 Listen to another parable: There was a landowner who planted a vineyard. He put a wall around it, dug a winepress in it, and built a tower. Then he rented it out to some tenants and went away on a journey.

title: Matthew 21:34
content: 34 When the harvest time drew near, he sent his servants to the tenants to collect his share of the fruit.

title: Matthew 21:35
content: 35 But the tenants seized his servants. They beat one, killed another, and stoned a third.

title: Matthew 21:36
content: 36 Again, he sent other servants, more than the first group. But the tenants did the same to them.

title: Matthew 21:37
content: 37 Finally, he sent his son to them. ‘They will respect my son,’ he said.

title: Matthew 21:38
content: 38 But when the tenants saw the son, they said to one another, ‘This is the heir. Come, let us kill him and take his inheritance.’

title: Matthew 21:39
content: 39 So they seized him and threw him out of the vineyard and killed him.

title: Matthew 21:40
content: 40 Therefore, when the owner of the vineyard returns, what will he do to those tenants?”

title: Matthew 21:41
content: 41 “He will bring those wretches to a wretched end,” they replied, “and will rent out the vineyard to other tenants who will give him his share of the fruit at harvest time.”

title: Matthew 21:42
content: 42 Jesus said to them, “Have you never read in the Scriptures: ‘The stone the builders rejected has become the cornerstone. This is from the Lord, and it is marvelous in our eyes’?

title: Matthew 21:43
content: 43 Therefore I tell you that the kingdom of God will be taken away from you and given to a people who will produce its fruit.

title: Matthew 21:44
content: 44 He who falls on this stone will be broken to pieces, but he on whom it falls will be crushed.”

title: Matthew 21:45
content: 45 When the chief priests and Pharisees heard His parables, they knew that Jesus was speaking about them.

title: Matthew 21:46
content: 46 Although they wanted to arrest Him, they were afraid of the crowds, because the people regarded Him as a prophet.

title: Matthew 22:1
content: 1 Once again, Jesus spoke to them in parables:

title: Matthew 22:2
content: 2 “The kingdom of heaven is like a king who prepared a wedding banquet for his son.

title: Matthew 22:3
content: 3 He sent his servants to call those he had invited to the banquet, but they refused to come.

title: Matthew 22:4
content: 4 Again, he sent other servants and said, ‘Tell those who have been invited that I have prepared my dinner. My oxen and fattened cattle have been killed, and everything is ready. Come to the wedding banquet.’

title: Matthew 22:5
content: 5 But they paid no attention and went away, one to his field, another to his business.

title: Matthew 22:6
content: 6 The rest seized his servants, mistreated them, and killed them.

title: Matthew 22:7
content: 7 The king was enraged, and he sent his troops to destroy those murderers and burn their city.

title: Matthew 22:8
content: 8 Then he said to his servants, ‘The wedding banquet is ready, but those I invited were not worthy.

title: Matthew 22:9
content: 9 Go therefore to the crossroads and invite to the banquet as many as you can find.’

title: Matthew 22:10
content: 10 So the servants went out into the streets and gathered everyone they could find, both evil and good, and the wedding hall was filled with guests.

title: Matthew 22:11
content: 11 But when the king came in to see the guests, he spotted a man who was not dressed in wedding clothes.

title: Matthew 22:12
content: 12 ‘Friend,’ he asked, ‘how did you get in here without wedding clothes?’ But the man was speechless.

title: Matthew 22:13
content: 13 Then the king told the servants, ‘Tie him hand and foot, and throw him into the outer darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.’

title: Matthew 22:14
content: 14 For many are called, but few are chosen.”

title: Matthew 22:15
content: 15 Then the Pharisees went out and conspired to trap Jesus in His words.

title: Matthew 22:16
content: 16 They sent their disciples to Him along with the Herodians. “Teacher,” they said, “we know that You are honest and that You teach the way of God in accordance with the truth. You seek favor from no one, because You pay no attention to external appearance.

title: Matthew 22:17
content: 17 So tell us what You think: Is it lawful to pay taxes to Caesar or not?”

title: Matthew 22:18
content: 18 But Jesus knew their evil intent and said, “You hypocrites, why are you testing Me?

title: Matthew 22:19
content: 19 Show Me the coin used for the tax.” And they brought Him a denarius.

title: Matthew 22:20
content: 20 “Whose image is this,” He asked, “and whose inscription?”

title: Matthew 22:21
content: 21 “Caesar’s,” they answered. So Jesus told them, “Give to Caesar what is Caesar’s, and to God what is God’s.”

title: Matthew 22:22
content: 22 And when they heard this, they were amazed. So they left Him and went away.

title: Matthew 22:23
content: 23 That same day the Sadducees, who say there is no resurrection, came to Jesus and questioned Him.

title: Matthew 22:24
content: 24 “Teacher,” they said, “Moses declared that if a man dies without having children, his brother is to marry the widow and raise up offspring for him.

title: Matthew 22:25
content: 25 Now there were seven brothers among us. The first one married and died without having children. So he left his wife to his brother.

title: Matthew 22:26
content: 26 The same thing happened to the second and third brothers, down to the seventh.

title: Matthew 22:27
content: 27 And last of all, the woman died.

title: Matthew 22:28
content: 28 In the resurrection, then, whose wife will she be of the seven? For all of them were married to her.”

title: Matthew 22:29
content: 29 Jesus answered, “You are mistaken because you do not know the Scriptures or the power of God.

title: Matthew 22:30
content: 30 In the resurrection, people will neither marry nor be given in marriage. Instead, they will be like the angels in heaven.

title: Matthew 22:31
content: 31 But concerning the resurrection of the dead, have you not read what God said to you:

title: Matthew 22:32
content: 32 ‘I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’? He is not the God of the dead, but of the living.”

title: Matthew 22:33
content: 33 When the crowds heard this, they were astonished at His teaching.

title: Matthew 22:34
content: 34 And when the Pharisees heard that Jesus had silenced the Sadducees, they themselves gathered together.

title: Matthew 22:35
content: 35 One of them, an expert in the law, tested Him with a question:

title: Matthew 22:36
content: 36 “Teacher, which commandment is the greatest in the Law?”

title: Matthew 22:37
content: 37 Jesus declared, “‘Love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind.’

title: Matthew 22:38
content: 38 This is the first and greatest commandment.

title: Matthew 22:39
content: 39 And the second is like it: ‘Love your neighbor as yourself.’

title: Matthew 22:40
content: 40 All the Law and the Prophets hang on these two commandments.”

title: Matthew 22:41
content: 41 While the Pharisees were assembled, Jesus questioned them:

title: Matthew 22:42
content: 42 “What do you think about the Christ? Whose son is He?” “David’s,” they answered.

title: Matthew 22:43
content: 43 Jesus said to them, “How then does David in the Spirit call Him ‘Lord’? For he says:

title: Matthew 22:44
content: 44 ‘The Lord said to my Lord, “Sit at My right hand until I put Your enemies under Your feet.”’

title: Matthew 22:45
content: 45 So if David calls Him ‘Lord,’ how can He be David’s son?”

title: Matthew 22:46
content: 46 No one was able to answer a word, and from that day on no one dared to question Him any further.

title: Matthew 23:1
content: 1 Then Jesus spoke to the crowds and to His disciples:

title: Matthew 23:2
content: 2 “The scribes and Pharisees sit in Moses’ seat.

title: Matthew 23:3
content: 3 So practice and observe everything they tell you. But do not do what they do, for they do not practice what they preach.

title: Matthew 23:4
content: 4 They tie up heavy, burdensome loads and lay them on men’s shoulders, but they themselves are not willing to lift a finger to move them.

title: Matthew 23:5
content: 5 All their deeds are done for men to see. They broaden their phylacteries and lengthen their tassels.

title: Matthew 23:6
content: 6 They love the places of honor at banquets, the chief seats in the synagogues,

title: Matthew 23:7
content: 7 the greetings in the marketplaces, and the title of ‘Rabbi’ by which they are addressed.

title: Matthew 23:8
content: 8 But you are not to be called ‘Rabbi,’ for you have one Teacher, and you are all brothers.

title: Matthew 23:9
content: 9 And do not call anyone on earth your father, for you have one Father, who is in heaven.

title: Matthew 23:10
content: 10 Nor are you to be called instructors, for you have one Instructor, the Christ.

title: Matthew 23:11
content: 11 The greatest among you shall be your servant.

title: Matthew 23:12
content: 12 For whoever exalts himself will be humbled, and whoever humbles himself will be exalted.

title: Matthew 23:13
content: 13 Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You shut the kingdom of heaven in men’s faces. You yourselves do not enter, nor will you let in those who wish to enter.

title: Matthew 23:15
content: 15 Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You traverse land and sea to win a single convert, and when he becomes one, you make him twice as much a son of hell as you are.

title: Matthew 23:16
content: 16 Woe to you, blind guides! You say, ‘If anyone swears by the temple, it means nothing; but if anyone swears by the gold of the temple, he is bound by his oath.’

title: Matthew 23:17
content: 17 You blind fools! Which is greater: the gold, or the temple that makes it sacred?

title: Matthew 23:18
content: 18 And you say, ‘If anyone swears by the altar, it means nothing; but if anyone swears by the gift on it, he is bound by his oath.’

title: Matthew 23:19
content: 19 You blind men! Which is greater: the gift, or the altar that makes it sacred?

title: Matthew 23:20
content: 20 So then, he who swears by the altar swears by it and by everything on it.

title: Matthew 23:21
content: 21 And he who swears by the temple swears by it and by the One who dwells in it.

title: Matthew 23:22
content: 22 And he who swears by heaven swears by God’s throne and by the One who sits on it.

title: Matthew 23:23
content: 23 Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You pay tithes of mint, dill, and cumin. But you have disregarded the weightier matters of the law: justice, mercy, and faithfulness. You should have practiced the latter, without neglecting the former.

title: Matthew 23:24
content: 24 You blind guides! You strain out a gnat but swallow a camel.

title: Matthew 23:25
content: 25 Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You clean the outside of the cup and dish, but inside they are full of greed and self-indulgence.

title: Matthew 23:26
content: 26 Blind Pharisee! First clean the inside of the cup and dish, so that the outside may become clean as well.

title: Matthew 23:27
content: 27 Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You are like whitewashed tombs, which look beautiful on the outside but on the inside are full of dead men’s bones and every kind of impurity.

title: Matthew 23:28
content: 28 In the same way, on the outside you appear to be righteous, but on the inside you are full of hypocrisy and wickedness.

title: Matthew 23:29
content: 29 Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You build tombs for the prophets and decorate the monuments of the righteous.

title: Matthew 23:30
content: 30 And you say, ‘If we had lived in the days of our fathers, we would not have been partners with them in shedding the blood of the prophets.’

title: Matthew 23:31
content: 31 So you testify against yourselves that you are the sons of those who murdered the prophets.

title: Matthew 23:32
content: 32 Fill up, then, the measure of the sin of your fathers.

title: Matthew 23:33
content: 33 You snakes! You brood of vipers! How will you escape the sentence of hell?

title: Matthew 23:34
content: 34 Because of this, I am sending you prophets and wise men and teachers. Some of them you will kill and crucify, and others you will flog in your synagogues and persecute from town to town.

title: Matthew 23:35
content: 35 And so upon you will come all the righteous blood shed on earth, from the blood of righteous Abel to the blood of Zechariah son of Berechiah, whom you murdered between the temple and the altar.

title: Matthew 23:36
content: 36 Truly I tell you, all these things will come upon this generation.

title: Matthew 23:37
content: 37 O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, who kills the prophets and stones those sent to her, how often I have longed to gather your children together, as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, but you were unwilling!

title: Matthew 23:38
content: 38 Look, your house is left to you desolate.

title: Matthew 23:39
content: 39 For I tell you that you will not see Me again until you say, ‘Blessed is He who comes in the name of the Lord.’”

title: Matthew 24:1
content: 1 As Jesus left the temple and was walking away, His disciples came up to Him to point out its buildings.

title: Matthew 24:2
content: 2 “Do you see all these things?” He replied. “Truly I tell you, not one stone here will be left on another; every one will be thrown down.”

title: Matthew 24:3
content: 3 While Jesus was sitting on the Mount of Olives, the disciples came to Him privately. “Tell us,” they said, “when will these things happen, and what will be the sign of Your coming and of the end of the age?”

title: Matthew 24:4
content: 4 Jesus answered, “See to it that no one deceives you.

title: Matthew 24:5
content: 5 For many will come in My name, claiming, ‘I am the Christ,’ and will deceive many.

title: Matthew 24:6
content: 6 You will hear of wars and rumors of wars, but see to it that you are not alarmed. These things must happen, but the end is still to come.

title: Matthew 24:7
content: 7 Nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. There will be famines and earthquakes in various places.

title: Matthew 24:8
content: 8 All these are the beginning of birth pains.

title: Matthew 24:9
content: 9 Then they will deliver you over to be persecuted and killed, and you will be hated by all nations because of My name.

title: Matthew 24:10
content: 10 At that time many will fall away and will betray and hate one another,

title: Matthew 24:11
content: 11 and many false prophets will arise and deceive many.

title: Matthew 24:12
content: 12 Because of the multiplication of wickedness, the love of most will grow cold.

title: Matthew 24:13
content: 13 But the one who perseveres to the end will be saved.

title: Matthew 24:14
content: 14 And this gospel of the kingdom will be preached in all the world as a testimony to all nations, and then the end will come.

title: Matthew 24:15
content: 15 So when you see standing in the holy place ‘the abomination of desolation,’ spoken of by the prophet Daniel (let the reader understand),

title: Matthew 24:16
content: 16 then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains.

title: Matthew 24:17
content: 17 Let no one on the housetop come down to retrieve anything from his house.

title: Matthew 24:18
content: 18 And let no one in the field return for his cloak.

title: Matthew 24:19
content: 19 How miserable those days will be for pregnant and nursing mothers!

title: Matthew 24:20
content: 20 Pray that your flight will not occur in the winter or on the Sabbath.

title: Matthew 24:21
content: 21 For at that time there will be great tribulation, unseen from the beginning of the world until now, and never to be seen again.

title: Matthew 24:22
content: 22 If those days had not been cut short, nobody would be saved. But for the sake of the elect, those days will be cut short.

title: Matthew 24:23
content: 23 At that time, if anyone says to you, ‘Look, here is the Christ!’ or ‘There He is!’ do not believe it.

title: Matthew 24:24
content: 24 For false Christs and false prophets will appear and perform great signs and wonders to deceive even the elect, if that were possible.

title: Matthew 24:25
content: 25 See, I have told you in advance.

title: Matthew 24:26
content: 26 So if they tell you, ‘There He is, in the wilderness,’ do not go out, or, ‘Here He is, in the inner rooms,’ do not believe it.

title: Matthew 24:27
content: 27 For just as the lightning comes from the east and flashes as far as the west, so will be the coming of the Son of Man.

title: Matthew 24:28
content: 28 Wherever there is a carcass, there the vultures will gather.

title: Matthew 24:29
content: 29 Immediately after the tribulation of those days: ‘The sun will be darkened, and the moon will not give its light; the stars will fall from the sky, and the powers of the heavens will be shaken.’

title: Matthew 24:30
content: 30 At that time the sign of the Son of Man will appear in heaven, and all the tribes of the earth will mourn. They will see the Son of Man coming on the clouds of heaven with power and great glory.

title: Matthew 24:31
content: 31 And He will send out His angels with a loud trumpet call, and they will gather His elect from the four winds, from one end of the heavens to the other.

title: Matthew 24:32
content: 32 Now learn this lesson from the fig tree: As soon as its branches become tender and sprout leaves, you know that summer is near.

title: Matthew 24:33
content: 33 So also, when you see all these things, you will know that He is near, right at the door.

title: Matthew 24:34
content: 34 Truly I tell you, this generation will not pass away until all these things have happened.

title: Matthew 24:35
content: 35 Heaven and earth will pass away, but My words will never pass away.

title: Matthew 24:36
content: 36 No one knows about that day or hour, not even the angels in heaven, nor the Son, but only the Father.

title: Matthew 24:37
content: 37 As it was in the days of Noah, so will it be at the coming of the Son of Man.

title: Matthew 24:38
content: 38 For in the days before the flood, people were eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage, up to the day Noah entered the ark.

title: Matthew 24:39
content: 39 And they were oblivious until the flood came and swept them all away. So will it be at the coming of the Son of Man.

title: Matthew 24:40
content: 40 Two men will be in the field: one will be taken and the other left.

title: Matthew 24:41
content: 41 Two women will be grinding at the mill: one will be taken and the other left.

title: Matthew 24:42
content: 42 Therefore keep watch, because you do not know the day on which your Lord will come.

title: Matthew 24:43
content: 43 But understand this: If the homeowner had known in which watch of the night the thief was coming, he would have kept watch and would not have let his house be broken into.

title: Matthew 24:44
content: 44 For this reason, you also must be ready, because the Son of Man will come at an hour you do not expect.

title: Matthew 24:45
content: 45 Who then is the faithful and wise servant, whom the master has put in charge of his household, to give the others their food at the proper time?

title: Matthew 24:46
content: 46 Blessed is that servant whose master finds him doing so when he returns.

title: Matthew 24:47
content: 47 Truly I tell you, he will put him in charge of all his possessions.

title: Matthew 24:48
content: 48 But suppose that servant is wicked and says in his heart, ‘My master will be away a long time.’

title: Matthew 24:49
content: 49 And he begins to beat his fellow servants and to eat and drink with drunkards.

title: Matthew 24:50
content: 50 The master of that servant will come on a day he does not expect and at an hour he does not anticipate.

title: Matthew 24:51
content: 51 Then he will cut him to pieces and assign him a place with the hypocrites, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

title: Matthew 25:1
content: 1 “At that time the kingdom of heaven will be like ten virgins who took their lamps and went out to meet the bridegroom.

title: Matthew 25:2
content: 2 Five of them were foolish, and five were wise.

title: Matthew 25:3
content: 3 The foolish ones took their lamps but did not take along any extra oil.

title: Matthew 25:4
content: 4 But the wise ones took oil in flasks along with their lamps.

title: Matthew 25:5
content: 5 When the bridegroom was delayed, they all became drowsy and fell asleep.

title: Matthew 25:6
content: 6 At midnight the cry rang out: ‘Here is the bridegroom! Come out to meet him!’

title: Matthew 25:7
content: 7 Then all the virgins woke up and trimmed their lamps.

title: Matthew 25:8
content: 8 The foolish ones said to the wise, ‘Give us some of your oil; our lamps are going out.’

title: Matthew 25:9
content: 9 ‘No,’ said the wise ones, ‘or there may not be enough for both us and you. Instead, go to those who sell oil and buy some for yourselves.’

title: Matthew 25:10
content: 10 But while they were on their way to buy it, the bridegroom arrived. Those who were ready went in with him to the wedding banquet, and the door was shut.

title: Matthew 25:11
content: 11 Later the other virgins arrived and said, ‘Lord, lord, open the door for us!’

title: Matthew 25:12
content: 12 But he replied, ‘Truly I tell you, I do not know you.’

title: Matthew 25:13
content: 13 Therefore keep watch, because you do not know the day or the hour.

title: Matthew 25:14
content: 14 For it is just like a man going on a journey, who called his servants and entrusted them with his possessions.

title: Matthew 25:15
content: 15 To one he gave five talents, to another two talents, and to another one talent—each according to his own ability. And he went on his journey.

title: Matthew 25:16
content: 16 The servant who had received the five talents went at once and put them to work and gained five more.

title: Matthew 25:17
content: 17 Likewise, the one with the two talents gained two more.

title: Matthew 25:18
content: 18 But the servant who had received the one talent went off, dug a hole in the ground, and hid his master’s money.

title: Matthew 25:19
content: 19 After a long time the master of those servants returned and settled accounts with them.

title: Matthew 25:20
content: 20 The servant who had received the five talents came and presented five more. ‘Master,’ he said, ‘you entrusted me with five talents. See, I have gained five more.’

title: Matthew 25:21
content: 21 His master replied, ‘Well done, good and faithful servant! You have been faithful with a few things; I will put you in charge of many things. Enter into the joy of your master!’

title: Matthew 25:22
content: 22 The servant who had received the two talents also came and said, ‘Master, you entrusted me with two talents. See, I have gained two more.’

title: Matthew 25:23
content: 23 His master replied, ‘Well done, good and faithful servant! You have been faithful with a few things; I will put you in charge of many things. Enter into the joy of your master!’

title: Matthew 25:24
content: 24 Finally, the servant who had received the one talent came and said, ‘Master, I knew that you are a hard man, reaping where you have not sown and gathering where you have not scattered seed.

title: Matthew 25:25
content: 25 So I was afraid and went out and hid your talent in the ground. See, you have what belongs to you.’

title: Matthew 25:26
content: 26 ‘You wicked, lazy servant!’ replied his master. ‘You knew that I reap where I have not sown and gather where I have not scattered seed.

title: Matthew 25:27
content: 27 Then you should have deposited my money with the bankers, and on my return I would have received it back with interest.

title: Matthew 25:28
content: 28 Therefore take the talent from him and give it to the one who has ten talents.

title: Matthew 25:29
content: 29 For everyone who has will be given more, and he will have an abundance. But the one who does not have, even what he has will be taken away from him.

title: Matthew 25:30
content: 30 And throw that worthless servant into the outer darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.’

title: Matthew 25:31
content: 31 When the Son of Man comes in His glory, and all the angels with Him, He will sit on His glorious throne.

title: Matthew 25:32
content: 32 All the nations will be gathered before Him, and He will separate the people one from another, as a shepherd separates the sheep from the goats.

title: Matthew 25:33
content: 33 He will place the sheep on His right and the goats on His left.

title: Matthew 25:34
content: 34 Then the King will say to those on His right, ‘Come, you who are blessed by My Father, inherit the kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world.

title: Matthew 25:35
content: 35 For I was hungry and you gave Me something to eat, I was thirsty and you gave Me something to drink, I was a stranger and you took Me in,

title: Matthew 25:36
content: 36 I was naked and you clothed Me, I was sick and you looked after Me, I was in prison and you visited Me.’

title: Matthew 25:37
content: 37 Then the righteous will answer Him, ‘Lord, when did we see You hungry and feed You, or thirsty and give You something to drink?

title: Matthew 25:38
content: 38 When did we see You a stranger and take You in, or naked and clothe You?

title: Matthew 25:39
content: 39 When did we see You sick or in prison and visit You?’

title: Matthew 25:40
content: 40 And the King will reply, ‘Truly I tell you, whatever you did for one of the least of these brothers of Mine, you did for Me.’

title: Matthew 25:41
content: 41 Then He will say to those on His left, ‘Depart from Me, you who are cursed, into the eternal fire prepared for the devil and his angels.

title: Matthew 25:42
content: 42 For I was hungry and you gave Me nothing to eat, I was thirsty and you gave Me nothing to drink,

title: Matthew 25:43
content: 43 I was a stranger and you did not take Me in, I was naked and you did not clothe Me, I was sick and in prison and you did not look after Me.’

title: Matthew 25:44
content: 44 And they too will reply, ‘Lord, when did we see You hungry or thirsty or a stranger or naked or sick or in prison, and did not minister to You?’

title: Matthew 25:45
content: 45 Then the King will answer, ‘Truly I tell you, whatever you did not do for one of the least of these, you did not do for Me.’

title: Matthew 25:46
content: 46 And they will go away into eternal punishment, but the righteous into eternal life.”

title: Matthew 26:1
content: 1 When Jesus had finished saying all these things, He told His disciples,

title: Matthew 26:2
content: 2 “You know that the Passover is two days away, and the Son of Man will be handed over to be crucified.”

title: Matthew 26:3
content: 3 At that time the chief priests and elders of the people assembled in the courtyard of the high priest, whose name was Caiaphas,

title: Matthew 26:4
content: 4 and they conspired to arrest Jesus covertly and kill Him.

title: Matthew 26:5
content: 5 “But not during the feast,” they said, “or there may be a riot among the people.”

title: Matthew 26:6
content: 6 While Jesus was in Bethany in the home of Simon the Leper,

title: Matthew 26:7
content: 7 a woman came to Him with an alabaster jar of expensive perfume, which she poured on His head as He reclined at the table.

title: Matthew 26:8
content: 8 When the disciples saw this, they were indignant and asked, “Why this waste?

title: Matthew 26:9
content: 9 This perfume could have been sold at a high price, and the money given to the poor.”

title: Matthew 26:10
content: 10 Aware of this, Jesus asked, “Why are you bothering this woman? She has done a beautiful deed to Me.

title: Matthew 26:11
content: 11 The poor you will always have with you, but you will not always have Me.

title: Matthew 26:12
content: 12 By pouring this perfume on Me, she has prepared My body for burial.

title: Matthew 26:13
content: 13 Truly I tell you, wherever this gospel is preached in all the world, what she has done will also be told in memory of her.”

title: Matthew 26:14
content: 14 Then one of the Twelve, the one called Judas Iscariot, went to the chief priests

title: Matthew 26:15
content: 15 and asked, “What are you willing to give me if I hand Him over to you?” And they set out for him thirty pieces of silver.

title: Matthew 26:16
content: 16 So from then on Judas looked for an opportunity to betray Jesus.

title: Matthew 26:17
content: 17 On the first day of the Feast of Unleavened Bread, the disciples came to Jesus and asked, “Where do You want us to prepare for You to eat the Passover?”

title: Matthew 26:18
content: 18 He answered, “Go into the city to a certain man and tell him that the Teacher says, ‘My time is near. I will keep the Passover with My disciples at your house.’”

title: Matthew 26:19
content: 19 So the disciples did as Jesus had directed them and prepared the Passover.

title: Matthew 26:20
content: 20 When evening came, Jesus was reclining with the twelve disciples.

title: Matthew 26:21
content: 21 And while they were eating, He said to them, “Truly I tell you, one of you will betray Me.”

title: Matthew 26:22
content: 22 They were deeply grieved and began to ask Him one after another, “Surely not I, Lord?”

title: Matthew 26:23
content: 23 Jesus answered, “The one who has dipped his hand into the bowl with Me will betray Me.

title: Matthew 26:24
content: 24 The Son of Man will go just as it is written about Him, but woe to that man by whom He is betrayed. It would be better for him if he had not been born.”

title: Matthew 26:25
content: 25 Then Judas, who would betray Him, said, “Surely not I, Rabbi?” Jesus answered, “You have said it yourself.”

title: Matthew 26:26
content: 26 While they were eating, Jesus took bread, spoke a blessing and broke it, and gave it to the disciples, saying, “Take and eat; this is My body.”

title: Matthew 26:27
content: 27 Then He took the cup, gave thanks, and gave it to them, saying, “Drink from it, all of you.

title: Matthew 26:28
content: 28 This is My blood of the covenant, which is poured out for many for the forgiveness of sins.

title: Matthew 26:29
content: 29 I tell you, I will not drink of this fruit of the vine from now on until that day when I drink it anew with you in My Father’s kingdom.”

title: Matthew 26:30
content: 30 And when they had sung a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.

title: Matthew 26:31
content: 31 Then Jesus said to them, “This very night you will all fall away on account of Me. For it is written: ‘I will strike the Shepherd, and the sheep of the flock will be scattered.’

title: Matthew 26:32
content: 32 But after I have risen, I will go ahead of you into Galilee.”

title: Matthew 26:33
content: 33 Peter said to Him, “Even if all fall away on account of You, I never will.”

title: Matthew 26:34
content: 34 “Truly I tell you,” Jesus declared, “this very night, before the rooster crows, you will deny Me three times.”

title: Matthew 26:35
content: 35 Peter replied, “Even if I have to die with You, I will never deny You.” And all the other disciples said the same thing.

title: Matthew 26:36
content: 36 Then Jesus went with His disciples to a place called Gethsemane, and He told them, “Sit here while I go over there and pray.”

title: Matthew 26:37
content: 37 He took with Him Peter and the two sons of Zebedee and began to be sorrowful and deeply distressed.

title: Matthew 26:38
content: 38 Then He said to them, “My soul is consumed with sorrow to the point of death. Stay here and keep watch with Me.”

title: Matthew 26:39
content: 39 Going a little farther, He fell facedown and prayed, “My Father, if it is possible, let this cup pass from Me. Yet not as I will, but as You will.”

title: Matthew 26:40
content: 40 Then Jesus returned to the disciples and found them sleeping. “Were you not able to keep watch with Me for one hour?” He asked Peter.

title: Matthew 26:41
content: 41 “Watch and pray so that you will not enter into temptation. For the spirit is willing, but the body is weak.”

title: Matthew 26:42
content: 42 A second time He went away and prayed, “My Father, if this cup cannot pass unless I drink it, may Your will be done.”

title: Matthew 26:43
content: 43 And again Jesus returned and found them sleeping, for their eyes were heavy.

title: Matthew 26:44
content: 44 So He left them and went away once more and prayed a third time, saying the same thing.

title: Matthew 26:45
content: 45 Then He returned to the disciples and said, “Are you still sleeping and resting? Look, the hour is near, and the Son of Man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.

title: Matthew 26:46
content: 46 Rise, let us go! See, My betrayer is approaching!”

title: Matthew 26:47
content: 47 While Jesus was still speaking, Judas, one of the Twelve, arrived, accompanied by a large crowd armed with swords and clubs, sent from the chief priests and elders of the people.

title: Matthew 26:48
content: 48 Now the betrayer had arranged a signal with them: “The One I kiss is the man; arrest Him.”

title: Matthew 26:49
content: 49 Going directly to Jesus, he said, “Greetings, Rabbi!” and kissed Him.

title: Matthew 26:50
content: 50 “Friend,” Jesus replied, “do what you came for.” Then the men stepped forward, seized Jesus, and arrested Him.

title: Matthew 26:51
content: 51 At this, one of Jesus’ companions drew his sword and struck the servant of the high priest, cutting off his ear.

title: Matthew 26:52
content: 52 “Put your sword back in its place,” Jesus said to him. “For all who draw the sword will die by the sword.

title: Matthew 26:53
content: 53 Are you not aware that I can call on My Father, and He will at once put at My disposal more than twelve legions of angels?

title: Matthew 26:54
content: 54 But how then would the Scriptures be fulfilled that say it must happen this way?”

title: Matthew 26:55
content: 55 At that time Jesus said to the crowd, “Have you come out with swords and clubs to arrest Me as you would an outlaw? Every day I sat teaching in the temple courts, and you did not arrest Me.

title: Matthew 26:56
content: 56 But this has all happened so that the writings of the prophets would be fulfilled.” Then all the disciples deserted Him and fled.

title: Matthew 26:57
content: 57 Those who had arrested Jesus led Him away to the house of Caiaphas the high priest, where the scribes and elders had gathered.

title: Matthew 26:58
content: 58 But Peter followed Him at a distance, right up to the courtyard of the high priest. And he went in and sat down with the guards to see the outcome.

title: Matthew 26:59
content: 59 Now the chief priests and the whole Sanhedrin were seeking false testimony against Jesus in order to put Him to death.

title: Matthew 26:60
content: 60 But they did not find any, though many false witnesses came forward. Finally two came forward

title: Matthew 26:61
content: 61 and declared, “This man said, ‘I am able to destroy the temple of God and rebuild it in three days.’”

title: Matthew 26:62
content: 62 So the high priest stood up and asked Him, “Have You no answer? What are these men testifying against You?”

title: Matthew 26:63
content: 63 But Jesus remained silent. Then the high priest said to Him, “I charge You under oath by the living God: Tell us if You are the Christ, the Son of God.”

title: Matthew 26:64
content: 64 “You have said it yourself,” Jesus answered. “But I say to all of you, from now on you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of Power and coming on the clouds of heaven.”

title: Matthew 26:65
content: 65 At this, the high priest tore his clothes and declared, “He has blasphemed! Why do we need any more witnesses? Look, now you have heard the blasphemy.

title: Matthew 26:66
content: 66 What do you think?” “He deserves to die,” they answered.

title: Matthew 26:67
content: 67 Then they spit in His face and struck Him. Others slapped Him

title: Matthew 26:68
content: 68 and said, “Prophesy to us, Christ! Who hit You?”

title: Matthew 26:69
content: 69 Meanwhile, Peter was sitting out in the courtyard, and a servant girl came up to him. “You also were with Jesus the Galilean,” she said.

title: Matthew 26:70
content: 70 But he denied it before them all: “I do not know what you are talking about.”

title: Matthew 26:71
content: 71 When Peter had gone out to the gateway, another servant girl saw him and said to the people there, “This man was with Jesus of Nazareth.”

title: Matthew 26:72
content: 72 And again he denied it with an oath: “I do not know the man!”

title: Matthew 26:73
content: 73 After a little while, those standing nearby came up to Peter. “Surely you are one of them,” they said, “for your accent gives you away.”

title: Matthew 26:74
content: 74 At that he began to curse and swear to them, “I do not know the man!” And immediately a rooster crowed.

title: Matthew 26:75
content: 75 Then Peter remembered the word that Jesus had spoken: “Before the rooster crows, you will deny Me three times.” And he went outside and wept bitterly.

title: Matthew 27:1
content: 1 When morning came, all the chief priests and elders of the people conspired against Jesus to put Him to death.

title: Matthew 27:2
content: 2 They bound Him, led Him away, and handed Him over to Pilate the governor.

title: Matthew 27:3
content: 3 When Judas, who had betrayed Him, saw that Jesus was condemned, he was filled with remorse and returned the thirty pieces of silver to the chief priests and elders.

title: Matthew 27:4
content: 4 “I have sinned by betraying innocent blood,” he said. “What is that to us?” they replied. “You bear the responsibility.”

title: Matthew 27:5
content: 5 So Judas threw the silver into the temple and left. Then he went away and hanged himself.

title: Matthew 27:6
content: 6 The chief priests picked up the pieces of silver and said, “It is unlawful to put this into the treasury, since it is blood money.”

title: Matthew 27:7
content: 7 After conferring together, they used the money to buy the potter’s field as a burial place for foreigners.

title: Matthew 27:8
content: 8 That is why it has been called the Field of Blood to this day.

title: Matthew 27:9
content: 9 Then what was spoken through Jeremiah the prophet was fulfilled: “They took the thirty pieces of silver, the price set on Him by the people of Israel,

title: Matthew 27:10
content: 10 and they gave them for the potter’s field, as the Lord had commanded me.”

title: Matthew 27:11
content: 11 Meanwhile Jesus stood before the governor, who questioned Him: “Are You the King of the Jews?” “You have said so,” Jesus replied.

title: Matthew 27:12
content: 12 And when He was accused by the chief priests and elders, He gave no answer.

title: Matthew 27:13
content: 13 Then Pilate asked Him, “Do You not hear how many charges they are bringing against You?”

title: Matthew 27:14
content: 14 But Jesus gave no answer, not even to a single charge, much to the governor’s amazement.

title: Matthew 27:15
content: 15 Now it was the governor’s custom at the feast to release to the crowd a prisoner of their choosing.

title: Matthew 27:16
content: 16 At that time they were holding a notorious prisoner named Barabbas.

title: Matthew 27:17
content: 17 So when the crowd had assembled, Pilate asked them, “Which one do you want me to release to you: Barabbas, or Jesus who is called Christ?”

title: Matthew 27:18
content: 18 For he knew it was out of envy that they had handed Jesus over to him.

title: Matthew 27:19
content: 19 While Pilate was sitting on the judgment seat, his wife sent him this message: “Have nothing to do with that innocent man, for I have suffered terribly in a dream today because of Him.”

title: Matthew 27:20
content: 20 But the chief priests and elders persuaded the crowds to ask for Barabbas and to have Jesus put to death.

title: Matthew 27:21
content: 21 “Which of the two do you want me to release to you?” asked the governor. “Barabbas,” they replied.

title: Matthew 27:22
content: 22 “What then should I do with Jesus who is called Christ?” Pilate asked. They all answered, “Crucify Him!”

title: Matthew 27:23
content: 23 “Why?” asked Pilate. “What evil has He done?” But they shouted all the louder, “Crucify Him!”

title: Matthew 27:24
content: 24 When Pilate saw that he was accomplishing nothing, but that instead a riot was breaking out, he took water and washed his hands before the crowd. “I am innocent of this man’s blood,” he said. “You bear the responsibility.”

title: Matthew 27:25
content: 25 All the people answered, “His blood be on us and on our children!”

title: Matthew 27:26
content: 26 So Pilate released Barabbas to them. But he had Jesus flogged, and handed Him over to be crucified.

title: Matthew 27:27
content: 27 Then the governor’s soldiers took Jesus into the Praetorium and gathered the whole company around Him.

title: Matthew 27:28
content: 28 They stripped Him and put a scarlet robe on Him.

title: Matthew 27:29
content: 29 And they twisted together a crown of thorns and set it on His head. They put a staff in His right hand, knelt down before Him, and mocked Him, saying, “Hail, King of the Jews!”

title: Matthew 27:30
content: 30 Then they spit on Him and took the staff and struck Him on the head repeatedly.

title: Matthew 27:31
content: 31 After they had mocked Him, they removed the robe and put His own clothes back on Him. Then they led Him away to crucify Him.

title: Matthew 27:32
content: 32 Along the way they found a man from Cyrene, named Simon, and they forced him to carry the cross of Jesus.

title: Matthew 27:33
content: 33 And when they came to a place called Golgotha, which means The Place of the Skull,

title: Matthew 27:34
content: 34 they offered Him wine to drink, mixed with gall; but after tasting it, He refused to drink it.

title: Matthew 27:35
content: 35 When they had crucified Him, they divided up His garments by casting lots.

title: Matthew 27:36
content: 36 And sitting down, they kept watch over Him there.

title: Matthew 27:37
content: 37 Above His head they posted the written charge against Him: THIS IS JESUS, THE KING OF THE JEWS.

title: Matthew 27:38
content: 38 Two robbers were crucified with Him, one on His right and the other on His left.

title: Matthew 27:39
content: 39 And those who passed by heaped abuse on Him, shaking their heads

title: Matthew 27:40
content: 40 and saying, “You who are going to destroy the temple and rebuild it in three days, save Yourself! If You are the Son of God, come down from the cross!”

title: Matthew 27:41
content: 41 In the same way, the chief priests, scribes, and elders mocked Him, saying,

title: Matthew 27:42
content: 42 “He saved others, but He cannot save Himself. He is the King of Israel! Let Him come down now from the cross, and we will believe in Him.

title: Matthew 27:43
content: 43 He trusts in God. Let God deliver Him now if He wants Him. For He said, ‘I am the Son of God.’”

title: Matthew 27:44
content: 44 In the same way, even the robbers who were crucified with Him berated Him.

title: Matthew 27:45
content: 45 From the sixth hour until the ninth hour darkness came over all the land.

title: Matthew 27:46
content: 46 About the ninth hour Jesus cried out in a loud voice, “Eli, Eli, lema sabachthani?” which means, “My God, My God, why have You forsaken Me?”

title: Matthew 27:47
content: 47 When some of those standing there heard this, they said, “He is calling Elijah.”

title: Matthew 27:48
content: 48 One of them quickly ran and brought a sponge. He filled it with sour wine, put it on a reed, and held it up for Jesus to drink.

title: Matthew 27:49
content: 49 But the others said, “Leave Him alone. Let us see if Elijah comes to save Him.”

title: Matthew 27:50
content: 50 When Jesus had cried out again in a loud voice, He yielded up His spirit.

title: Matthew 27:51
content: 51 At that moment the veil of the temple was torn in two from top to bottom. The earth quaked, and the rocks were split.

title: Matthew 27:52
content: 52 The tombs broke open, and the bodies of many saints who had fallen asleep were raised.

title: Matthew 27:53
content: 53 After Jesus’ resurrection, when they had come out of the tombs, they entered the holy city and appeared to many people.

title: Matthew 27:54
content: 54 When the centurion and those with him who were guarding Jesus saw the earthquake and all that had happened, they were terrified and said, “Truly this was the Son of God.”

title: Matthew 27:55
content: 55 And many women were there, watching from a distance. They had followed Jesus from Galilee to minister to Him.

title: Matthew 27:56
content: 56 Among them were Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James and Joseph, and the mother of Zebedee’s sons.

title: Matthew 27:57
content: 57 When it was evening, there came a rich man from Arimathea named Joseph, who himself was a disciple of Jesus.

title: Matthew 27:58
content: 58 He went to Pilate to ask for the body of Jesus, and Pilate ordered that it be given to him.

title: Matthew 27:59
content: 59 So Joseph took the body, wrapped it in a clean linen cloth,

title: Matthew 27:60
content: 60 and placed it in his own new tomb that he had cut into the rock. Then he rolled a great stone across the entrance to the tomb and went away.

title: Matthew 27:61
content: 61 Mary Magdalene and the other Mary were sitting there opposite the tomb.

title: Matthew 27:62
content: 62 The next day, the one after Preparation Day, the chief priests and Pharisees assembled before Pilate.

title: Matthew 27:63
content: 63 “Sir,” they said, “we remember that while He was alive that deceiver said, ‘After three days I will rise again.’

title: Matthew 27:64
content: 64 So give the order that the tomb be secured until the third day. Otherwise, His disciples may come and steal Him away and tell the people He has risen from the dead. And this last deception would be worse than the first.”

title: Matthew 27:65
content: 65 “You have a guard,” Pilate said. “Go, make the tomb as secure as you know how.”

title: Matthew 27:66
content: 66 So they went and secured the tomb by sealing the stone and posting the guard.

title: Matthew 28:1
content: 1 After the Sabbath, at dawn on the first day of the week, Mary Magdalene and the other Mary went to see the tomb.

title: Matthew 28:2
content: 2 Suddenly there was a great earthquake, for an angel of the Lord descended from heaven, rolled away the stone, and sat on it.

title: Matthew 28:3
content: 3 His appearance was like lightning, and his clothes were white as snow.

title: Matthew 28:4
content: 4 The guards trembled in fear of him and became like dead men.

title: Matthew 28:5
content: 5 But the angel said to the women, “Do not be afraid, for I know that you are looking for Jesus, who was crucified.

title: Matthew 28:6
content: 6 He is not here; He has risen, just as He said! Come, see the place where He lay.

title: Matthew 28:7
content: 7 Then go quickly and tell His disciples, ‘He has risen from the dead and is going ahead of you into Galilee. There you will see Him.’ See, I have told you.”

title: Matthew 28:8
content: 8 So they hurried away from the tomb in fear and great joy, and ran to tell His disciples.

title: Matthew 28:9
content: 9 Suddenly Jesus met them and said, “Greetings!” They came to Him, grasped His feet, and worshiped Him.

title: Matthew 28:10
content: 10 “Do not be afraid,” said Jesus. “Go and tell My brothers to go to Galilee. There they will see Me.”

title: Matthew 28:11
content: 11 While the women were on their way, some of the guards went into the city and reported to the chief priests all that had happened.

title: Matthew 28:12
content: 12 And after the chief priests had met with the elders and formed a plan, they gave the soldiers a large sum of money

title: Matthew 28:13
content: 13 and instructed them: “You are to say, ‘His disciples came by night and stole Him away while we were asleep.’

title: Matthew 28:14
content: 14 If this report reaches the governor, we will satisfy him and keep you out of trouble.”

title: Matthew 28:15
content: 15 So the guards took the money and did as they were instructed. And this account has been circulated among the Jews to this very day.

title: Matthew 28:16
content: 16 Meanwhile, the eleven disciples went to Galilee, to the mountain Jesus had designated.

title: Matthew 28:17
content: 17 When they saw Him, they worshiped Him, but some doubted.

title: Matthew 28:18
content: 18 Then Jesus came to them and said, “All authority in heaven and on earth has been given to Me.

title: Matthew 28:19
content: 19 Therefore go and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit,

title: Matthew 28:20
content: 20 and teaching them to obey all that I have commanded you. And surely I am with you always, even to the end of the age.”
